  • Year Round
    Receiving Testimonies

“I think it is great how you are providing an opportunity for people to recycle what they no longer wish to keep and give it to a good cause.  Plus, I love knowing that someone will have the delight of opening a surprise gift for the holidays that he/she otherwise would not have.  Your project makes me feel a part of something bigger than me, which is very gratifying” 
Laura Maria Hornsby

 I helped distribute unsolicited gifts to random people with Kalei in December of 2012. It was a memorable experience. The others had wrapped and bagged gifts and filled stockings for several days. They had designated some as best for kids, men or women so we tried to select an appropriate gift for whomever we stopped. People were so surprised to have something offered to them. I think some people may have thought we were strange but then amazed when they realized that this was a random act of kindness/generosity and that all we wanted was for them to pass it on as possible.
Wanda

“It is so much fun to watch the ripple effect of this and to see total strangers tear up with joy from receiving a gift from a stranger who wants nothing from them but who simply wants to spread some positive energy in the community”

Kalei

"Up until recently, Random Acts of Kindness were something I only appreciated on bumper stickers. When Kalei approached me to participate in her gift givers project last winter, I jumped on the occasion. Initially many people were cautious when we approached them as total strangers, only to light up like Christmas trees when they realized we were gifting them. A few months later I was in a retail store when a total stranger approached me and several others with store-wide savings coupons. She informed me she always prints extra coupons when she shops and hands them out. Both of these experiences lifted my spirit and give me hope that a brighter future lies ahead and begins with each and every one of us." 

Stephen P. Weiss, M.D.

I cannot express to you the joy that being a part of this brings. From the collecting, bagging, to giving the joy within you builds. When you see a stranger’s face go from confusion, then slowly to understanding. That's when their smile appears,changing everything. At that moment pure joy has taken over. It is amazing! In a world that teaches us it's all about self. It is a blessing for my girls to be involved with the sole purpose of others. Here is the best part. It doesn't matter what your skin is, what your job or income is, or how different your life's might be. This is a heart thing. Hearts working side by side….Why? Here is the kicker. Just because. Giving what every one of us desires. Simple kindness, love and joy. There is nothing like it! __JENNA

"When I first joined Gift Givers Anonymous and helped distribute gifts to unsuspecting receivers I was a bit apprehensive about approaching strangers.  I thought, “If anyone approached me in such a way, I would probably take a step back or keep walking.”  After watching Kalei approach people with a big smile, kind and comforting words, I thought, “I can do this.”  So I did.  The more I handed gifts the more comfortable I became.  The more comfortable I became the more I watched the people I approached relax.
Watching people’s reactions when we handed them a gift for no reason, other than to spread some gifts of Kindness was pure JOY!  The excitement on the people’s faces ... [click to read more about Mary Jo's experience]

I was fascinated with the project when you first told me about it. I think it is awesome to see people give to those in need without expecting anything in return. 
It is great to see how just a little gift and thought can really make someone else’s day and make their face glow! It has been a good experience to get my other friends involved in as well.
Giving from the heart is the most rewarding feeling. We are all so blessed and it is great to have an opportunity to share that blessing with others as well. 
(This project) has grown like an epidemic and epidemic of giving!! 
-Emily Arzate

Kalei,
I was overjoyed to receive gifts to help our women with breast cancer!! I felt like an angel had come out of nowhere to help our struggling women and their children. I was so happy to be able to deliver these gifts to the families with our partnering organizations. You should have seen the faces of the families as they received gifts just because….just because they are special, just because they are going through a hard time, just because someone out there was thinking of them and wanted to pay it forward!!! The spirit of giving and healing go together. As I received, I gave. And as the women and children received they will pass it on. It changes hearts and lives and I am so honored to be part of it!!!

Diane DaCamara
Anita Salas Memorial Fund


Donors:

 

Sharon’s Estate Sales

Since our estate sale company has been using Gift Givers Anonymous at the end of our sales, it has not only simplified our function both for us and for our clients, but it has also enriched our lives so much knowing that the things we didn’t sell will be used to do good in the community.  Gift Givers Anonymous is an incredibly amazing organization, and we enjoy and appreciate Kalei and Theresa and their volunteers so much.

Sharon Lusk
Owner of Sharon’s Estate Sales






Albuquerque Meadows Estate Sales

I would like to Thank You for your donation to our community.  I have worked with many organizations that have offered services but never seem to be reliable.  
I have referred your organization to many other donors because you schedule your pickups, arrive in a timely manner, bring sufficient help and are very professional.
I understand the items donated are given to people getting a new start in life or sometimes people that just need a Boost.  
Again, thank you for your Community service.

Natalie Guidry
Rod Johnson






Estate Sales by Wings
We have had the distinct pleasure of working closely with Gift Givers and, can say with out question that they provide an essential service to both client and, community combined. Their dedication and, hard work is beyond measure. No job is too big and, no need goes unfurnished. They are a blessing to our city and, a definite joy to work with.
Beverly Hubbard
Owner of Estate Sales by Wings

 

 

 

MCH Family Outreach
MCH Family Outreach (family) case managers have been partnering with Gift Givers Anonymous since before they had their current storage space.  GGA has filled a huge gap in the giving community – prior to GGA, there were almost no resources for furniture and household items our families desperately need when they are trying to recover from disastrous life events.  Thank you GGA for your cheerful generosity!  You guys are a joy to work with and you make our families’ and our lives much easier!
Virginia M. Lawlor (Ginger): Case Manager

St. Martin’s

Gift Givers Anonymous makes a huge impact in the lives of the clients of St. Martin’s Hospitality Center. Since August 2013, over 4,000 unique individuals have passed through our doors. These clients enter the shelter in desperate need of everything: shoes, clothing, undergarments, food, and hygiene products. The generosity of Gift Givers Anonymous allows us to fill these most basic needs, especially since GGA donates throughout the year and not just during the holiday season. GGA is also extremely important to clients moving into new housing, as they provide furniture, kitchenware, and linens for our clients. St. Martin’s has many programs but only with the help of sister programs, like Gift Givers Anonymous, could we fully support our clients at each stage of their journeys.
Linda Fuller Director of Employment Services/ St. Martin’s Hospitality Center


Barrett Foundation
First of all I would like to say Gift Givers Anonymous has been a BLESSING to my Ladies and Families in the Bridges Housing Program.  The furniture and other household items that you all have donated have help out so many of my clients. 
From the ladies and children in the Bridges Housing Program and myself, we want to thank Gift Givers Anonymous for all of their Generosity in giving and helping people in need.  Thanks again.

Laura Benjamin: Case Manager for Barrett Foundation / Bridges Transitional Housing
